channel.title: Radio Wazoo
channel.itunes:subtitle: Talk Radio for the Emotionally Crippled
channel.itunes:author: Wazoo Productions
channel.itunes:summary: This isn't your daddy's talk radio. Recorded at the seediest hours of the night in the heart of the French Quarter in New Orleans! Send the children to the babysitter and put your grandparents in the home. Radio Wazoo is here to rot your mind.
channel.description: This isn't your daddy's talk radio. Recorded at the seediest hours of the night in the heart of the French Quarter in New Orleans! Send the children to the babysitter and put your grandparents in the home. Radio Wazoo is here to rot your mind.

item.title: Season 2 Episode 8
item.itunes:author: Radio Wazoo
item.itunes:subtitle: The Road Trip Edition
item.itunes:summary: Join Joe and Jason on a self-indulgent nostalgia trip back to old haunts, where old feelings are re-awakened and new hope realized!
item.description: Join Joe and Jason on a self-indulgent nostalgia trip back to old haunts, where old feelings are re-awakened and new hope realized!
item.itunes:keywords: new orleans, orlando, road trip, nostalgia, nerdism

item.title: Season 2 Episode 7
item.itunes:author: Radio Wazoo
item.itunes:subtitle: Solo Joe and the Lost Episode
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, Joe goes solo and presents the new approach to the podcast, shares the "lost" episode with Nigel, Jason, and Nick, deals with a haunted studio, discusses social media, his terrible home-making skills, fear of the future, and other neuroses
item.description: In this episode, Joe goes solo and presents the new approach to the podcast, shares the "lost" episode with Nigel, Jason, and Nick, deals with a haunted studio, discusses social media, his terrible home-making skills, fear of the future, and other neuroses
item.itunes:keywords: new orleans, comedy, endlessjoe, social media, ghosts, fear, neuroses, french quarter, night-life, drinking

item.title: Season 2 Episode 6
item.itunes:author: Radio Wazoo
item.itunes:subtitle: Matt and Jack and Jason and Four Loko
item.itunes:summary: Hold onto your seats. Joe and Jason are visited in studio by Matt and Jack from the Matt and Jack Podvast for a round-table ram jam, fueled by copious amounts of Four Loko. This one unravels into blithering, slurring insanity by show's end, but before that, the guys talk Four Loko and the government ban, transients, social networking, gutterpunks, social conformity, the love and hate relationship with New Orleans, street hustlers, drunk dial Matt's mom in the midst of a mass Four Loko dementia, and slip into the mouth of madness.
item.description: Hold onto your seats. Joe and Jason are visited in studio by Matt and Jack from the Matt and Jack Podvast for a round-table ram jam, fueled by copious amounts of Four Loko. This one unravels into blithering, slurring insanity by show's end, but before that, the guys talk Four Loko and the government ban, transients, social networking, gutterpunks, social conformity, the love and hate relationship with New Orleans, street hustlers, drunk dial Matt's mom in the midst of a mass Four Loko dementia, and slip into the mouth of madness.
item.itunes:keywords: new orleans, eatpizza, twitter, jacksongravy, matt and jack podvast, wazoo productions, endlessjoe, captainpeppito, Four Loko, gutter punks, drinking

item.title: Season 2 Episode 5
item.itunes:author: Radio Wazoo
item.itunes:subtitle: We're Old and Sober
item.itunes:summary: Joe and Jason discuss awful local celebrities, the anniversary of Hurricane Katrina, mysterious balding, the dangers of drunken cellular device usage, Mardi Gras, getting older, and much more.
item.description: Joe and Jason discuss awful local celebrities, the anniversary of Hurricane Katrina, mysterious balding, the dangers of drunken cellular device usage, Mardi Gras, getting older, and much more.
item.itunes:keywords: new orleans, Hurricane Katrina, Mardi Gras, aging, drinking, mistakes, fear, sexy sexy horrible things

item.title: Season 2 Episode 4
item.itunes:author: Radio Wazoo
item.itunes:subtitle: We're All Doomed
item.itunes:summary: Joe is joined by Jason Trosclair (with a call-in appearance by Nigel P. Lee). The fellas talk about "Inception" and other movies, TV and technology trends, the disgrace of aging, the warm blanket of gadgetry and advertising, the silent shame of porn availability, the necessity of new toys, learning love lessons, the envy of the mentally handicapped, making it through poverty, and the sadness of sex.
item.description: Joe is joined by Jason Trosclair (with a call-in appearance by Nigel P. Lee). The fellas talk about "Inception" and other movies, TV and technology trends, the disgrace of aging, the warm blanket of gadgetry and advertising, the silent shame of porn availability, the necessity of new toys, learning love lessons, the envy of the mentally handicapped, making it through poverty, and the sadness of sex.
item.itunes:keywords: new orleans, wazoo, relationships, sex, Inception, Lost, entertainment, humor, trends, technology

item.title: Season 2 Episode 3
item.itunes:author: Radio Wazoo
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Get Hyphy
item.itunes:summary: Joe is once again joined by Jason Trosclair, and the fellas invite you to join in on their Chat Roullette drinking game as they get quite drunk and talk about the sexual desensitization of a generation, Comic-con and nerd culture, marketing racism, false culture, and the origins of Joe and Jason's fake band Alcohol and Roses. The guys make a couple of drunk dials, with a special coming-of-age story from Joe's mom.
item.description: Joe is once again joined by Jason Trosclair, and the fellas invite you to join in on their Chat Roullette drinking game as they get quite drunk and talk about the sexual desensitization of a generation, Comic-con and nerd culture, marketing racism, false culture, and the origins of Joe and Jason's fake band Alcohol and Roses. The guys make a couple of drunk dials, with a special coming-of-age story from Joe's mom.
item.itunes:keywords: new orleans, wazoo, sugarcane ninjas, racism, culture, hip hop, Chat Roullette, drinking, porn, Comic-con

item.title: Season 2 Episode 2
item.itunes:author: Radio Wazoo
item.itunes:subtitle: Enter the Man Cave!
item.itunes:summary: Joe is joined by old pal, Jason Trosclair as they discuss French Quarter oddities, music released in seasons, the terror of meeting women, the burdens and benefits of D-list Youtube fame, the terrifying prospect of aging, and how to be "okay."
item.description: Joe is joined by old pal, Jason Trosclair as they discuss French Quarter oddities, music released in seasons, the terror of meeting women, the burdens and benefits of D-list Youtube fame, the terrifying prospect of aging, and how to be "okay."
item.itunes:keywords: new orleans, french quarter, wazoo productions, endlessjoe, captainpeppito, dating, aging, comedy, crying

item.title: Season 2, Episode 1
item.itunes:author: Radio Wazoo
item.itunes:subtitle: The Anti-Triumphant Return!
item.itunes:summary: Joe discusses the new format, the reasons behind it, and is joined by internet entity and friend, Jennfabulous. They discuss Betty White, why dating is a nightmare, American gluttony, spawning children, hurricane preparedness, and golden showers!
item.description: Joe discusses the new format, the reasons behind it, and is joined by internet entity and friend, Jennfabulous. They discuss Betty White, why dating is a nightmare, American gluttony, spawning children, hurricane preparedness, and golden showers!
item.itunes:keywords: new orleans, wazoo, jennfabulous, betty white, hurricanes, parenthood, gluttony

item.title: Radio Wazoo #8
item.itunes:author: Wazoo Productions
item.itunes:subtitle: The Tear-Jerking Season 1 Finale
item.itunes:summary: In the final episode of the 1st season, the boys discuss the Saints Superbowl victory, drug company advertising, The Whisper Song, the double standard of sex toys, basic economics, Grimace's nemesis, whether or not Jesus would be as popular if he were a black-eyed dwarf, take listener phone calls, and introduce the secret word of the day. With an appearance by 20's Guy, plus plenty more!
item.description: In the final episode of the 1st season, the boys discuss the Saints Superbowl victory, drug company advertising, The Whisper Song, the double standard of sex toys, basic economics, Grimace's nemesis, whether or not Jesus would be as popular if he were a black-eyed dwarf, take listener phone calls, and introduce the secret word of the day. With an appearance by 20's Guy, plus plenty more!
item.itunes:keywords: new orleans, saints, superbowl 44, yin yang twins, drug companies, sex, vibrators, religion, hilarity

item.title: Radio Wazoo #7
item.itunes:author: Wazoo Productions
item.itunes:subtitle: We've Come to Rock Your Face Off
item.itunes:summary: The fellas talk about Nigel's deeply troubling (but hilarious) childhood, the huge (and largely imaginary) fandom caused by the show, the pure rock fury of George Thorogood, give movie reviews and previews, reminisce about the golden age of horror movies, discuss the worst possible ways to die, how they will all PROBABLY die, the awful awareness of aging, the possibilities of an AIDS vaccine, the myths and realities of going green, and give out the Wazoo Class Awards. With appearances by Wayne Perriwinkle (The Sack Guy), 20's Guy, your voicemails, and plenty more!
item.description: The fellas talk about Nigel's deeply troubling (but hilarious) childhood, the huge (and largely imaginary) fandom caused by the show, the pure rock fury of George Thorogood, give movie reviews and previews, reminisce about the golden age of horror movies, discuss the worst possible ways to die, how they will all PROBABLY die, the awful awareness of aging, the possibilities of an AIDS vaccine, the myths and realities of going green, and give out the Wazoo Class Awards. With appearances by Wayne Perriwinkle (The Sack Guy), 20's Guy, your voicemails, and plenty more!
item.itunes:keywords: new orleans, George Thorogood, movie reviews, horror, ways to die, aging, AIDS, going green, recycling, hilarity

item.title: Radio Wazoo #6
item.itunes:author: Wazoo Productions
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Get Awesome!
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, the gang discusses the worst STD of all, the touchy subjects of abortion and parenthood, marriage, class reunions, doomsday theories, political con-jobs, the 80's hit movie, "Gremlins", American Idol, the lie of adulthood, how much radio sucks, who would make a better male prostitute between Nigel and Grimace, how education and the emphasis on learning have died a horrible death over time, and make a plea for your love. With appearances by 20's Guy, Sean Bedlam, your brutal voicemails as usual, and other bits that promise to be a knee-slappin' good time.
item.description: In this episode, the gang discusses the worst STD of all, the touchy subjects of abortion and parenthood, marriage, class reunions, doomsday theories, political con-jobs, the 80's hit movie, "Gremlins", American Idol, the lie of adulthood, how much radio sucks, who would make a better male prostitute between Nigel and Grimace, how education and the emphasis on learning have died a horrible death over time, and make a plea for your love. With appearances by 20's Guy, Sean Bedlam, your brutal voicemails as usual, and other bits that promise to be a knee-slappin' good time.
item.itunes:keywords: new orleans, comedy, STDs, abortion, marriage, class reunions, 2012, politics, American Idol, prostituation, education

item.title: Radio Wazoo #5
item.itunes:author: Wazoo Productions
item.itunes:subtitle: They Can't All Be Zingers
item.itunes:summary: In this installment, Nick and Joe have to handle show duties minus Grimace and Nigel. They discuss the reasons why, present the Grimace and Nigel soundboard to the world, and broach the subjects of creepy grocery store employees, the origins of the radio show and the long-lost "manscussion" that started it all, media-induced health hysteria, Steven Seagal's new reality show filmed in the greater New Orleans area, Nick and Joe's prison stories, and call Grimace and Nigel for the REAL reasons of their absence. With appearances by Wayne Perriwinkle (The Sack Guy), 20's Guy, and vicious listener voicemails.
item.description: In this installment, Nick and Joe have to handle show duties minus Grimace and Nigel. With appearances by Wayne Perriwinkle (The Sack Guy), 20's Guy, and vicious listener voicemails.
item.itunes:keywords: new orleans, humor, wazoo, Steven Seagal, media, prison

item.title: Radio Wazoo #4
item.itunes:author: Wazoo Productions
item.itunes:subtitle: 4th Time's the Charm
item.itunes:summary: Here, the guys discuss the death of chivalry and the pick-up line, the patriotism of pornography and masturbation, the social networking craze, various cajun slang, the organic food scam, celebrity encounters turned ugly, how society dictates our behavior, vehicular self-stimulation, and field live listener phonecalls. With appearances by 20's Guy, your voicemails, and other sketches that will tickle you pink.
item.description: Here, the guys discuss the death of chivalry and the pick-up line, the patriotism of pornography and masturbation, the social networking craze, various cajun slang, the organic food scam, celebrity encounters turned ugly, how society dictates our behavior, vehicular self-stimulation, and field live listener phonecalls. With appearances by 20's Guy, your voicemails, and other sketches that will tickle you pink.
item.itunes:keywords: chivalry, patriotism, pornography, masturbation, social networking, Twitter, cajun, bayou, organic food,celebrities, New Orleans

item.title: Radio Wazoo #3
item.itunes:author: Wazoo Productions
item.itunes:subtitle: Round 3
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, the guys discuss the goddamn robots, video game realism, hobos vs gutter punks and squatters, celebrity look-alikes, which famous people should be swallowed by the Earth, rock and roll, the "fuck you" rules, Carroll O' Connor, Grimace's disdain for Nancy Grace, and their past job horror stories. With appearances by 20's Guy, Sean Bedlam, and Wayne Perriwinkle (The Sack Guy), with your abusive voicemails as well.

item.title: Radio Wazoo #2
item.itunes:author: Wazoo Productions
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode Numero Dos
item.itunes:summary: On the second go-around, the fellas talk about their vacation misadventures, try to figure out who is fatter and dumber between Grimace and Nigel, step-dudes, drug legalization, problems facing New Orleans, retard strength vs fat guy aggression, the science of ginger kids, celebrity deaths, urine fueled vehicles, the generational masturbation gap, and peanut butter and jelly sushi. With appearances by 20's Guy and your voicemails!

item.title: Radio Wazoo #1
item.itunes:author: Wazoo Productions
item.itunes:subtitle: The Inaugural Episode
item.itunes:summary: In the inaugural episode, the guys make their introductions, discuss the difficult mechanics of sharing a toilet, Nigel's horrific ass problems, pistol whipping, hand callouses, home remedies, the gayest thing ever, Lady Gaga, MILFs, how Wal-Mart is ruining the American dream, cleanliness, racism, and drink heavily throughout. With appearances by 20's Guy and your listener submitted voicemails of hate.
